david.hubbell

Class HorizontalCoinFlipHistogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • david.hubbell.HorizontalCoinFlipHistogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UpdatableGraph<TossValue>

    public class HorizontalCoinFlipHistogram
extends java.lang.Object
implements UpdatableGraph<TossValue>
    HorizontalCoinFlipHistogram Object

    As one of potentially many ways to display the outcome of a series of coin tosses, the HorizontalCoinFlipHistogram class implements the UpdatableGraph generic interface, using TossValue as the datatype passed to the update(TossValue) method. The goal of this class is to produce a horizontal histogram, which refers to a histogram in which the bars of data span from left to right as opposed to the more common vertical histogram. The specified behavior for this type of graph is for it to be of fixed domain. At the outset, the cursor for the array is set to point to the middle of the array. When a TossValue.HEADS value is passed to the update(TossValue)method, the cursor moves in the positive direction and increments the value stored at this new index. In the case of TossValue.TAILS, the cursor moves to the left and increments the value stored there. In the case that moving either right or left would cause the cursor to point outside the bounds of the array, the cursor remains where it is and increments the value stored at the current index. This has the potential to skew output, but we really don't care. At any time, the print() method can be called to produce a rendering of the histogram on the command line.

    Author:
    David Hubbell
    See Also:
    UpdatableGraph

    • Constructor Detail

      • HorizontalCoinFlipHistogram

        public HorizontalCoinFlipHistogram()
        Constructor. Creates a new instance of the HorizontalCoinFlipHistorgram class and initializes the array and cursor position. At the outset the cursor position will be in the middle of the array.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(TossValue value)
        Adds data to the histogram by moving the cursor and updating the referenced index according the kind of TossValue passed in. Values of TossValue.HEADS cause the cursor to move in the positive direction. Values of TossValue.TAILS cause the cursor to move in the negative direction. Wherever the cursor moves, it increments the value stored at the new location by one. If moving in a particular direction would cause the cursor to point outside of the bounds of the array, the cursor remains where it is and updates the current location.
        Specified by:
        update in interface UpdatableGraph<TossValue>
        Parameters:
        value - The outcome of a coin toss. Either TossValue.HEADS or TossValue.TAILS
        See Also:
        TossValue, UpdatableGraph

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints a representation of the graph to the command line.
        Specified by:
        print in interface UpdatableGraph<TossValue>
